meanings.sent1: The plant's growth showed inducibility when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent2: Her inducibility to try new things made her a great team player.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inducibility to chase laser pointers always entertained us.
meanings.sent4: The student's inducibility to learn new languages was like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's inducibility to wag its tail at the sound of a treat was adorable.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be induced.
meanings.sent1: The inducibility of the material to conduct electricity was impressive.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the inducibility of the reaction under different conditions.
meanings.sent3: The inducibility of laughter in the comedy show was contagious.
meanings.sent4: Her inducibility to help others was like a guiding light in the community.
meanings.sent5: The inducibility of creativity in the art class sparked new ideas.
